item.title: Max file-name length in an EXT4 file system.
item.author: xxxx
item.description: A recent discussion at work brought up the question “What can be the length of a file name in EXT4”. Or in other words, what would be the maximum character length of the name for a file in EXT4? Wikipedia states that it’s 255 Bytes, but how does that come to be? Is it 255 Bytes or 255 characters? In the kernel source for the 2.6 kernel series (the question was for a RHEL6/EXT4 combination), in fs/ext4/ext4.
